example.description: This example returns the Availability Zones that are available to you. The response includes Availability Zones only for the current region.

example.code:
PS C:\>$filter = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.Filter PS C:\>$filter.Name = "state" PS C:\>$filter.Values = "impaired"
# to query on more than one filter, use array syntax e.g. -Filters @( $filter1, $filter2 ) PS C:\>Get-EC2AvailabilityZone -Filter $filter
example.description: Returns the Availability Zones that match the specified filter(s). If your are using PowerShell v3 or higher this can be expressed as 'Get-EC2AvailabilityZone -Filter @{ Name="state";Value="impaired" }'.

Returns the Availability Zones that are in impaired status in zone us-east-1a for the region us-east-1 (PowerShell v3 or higher; for version 2, use the New-Object syntax to construct the filter specifications).
